verses.verse: If a man <S%H376><s%> shall steal <S%H1589><s%> an ox <S%H7794><s%>, or a sheep <S%H7716><s%>, and kill <S%H2873><s%> it, or sell <S%H4376><s%> it; he shall restore <S%H7999><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> oxen <S%H1241><s%> for an ox <S%H7794><s%>, and four <S%H702><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%> for a sheep <S%H7716><s%>.
¶ If a thief <S%H1590><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> breaking up <S%H4290><s%>, and be smitten <S%H5221><s%> that he die <S%H4191><s%>, there shall no blood <S%H1818><s%> be shed for him.

If the sun <S%H8121><s%> be risen <S%H2224><s%> upon him, there shall be blood <S%H1818><s%> shed for him; for he should make full <S%H7999><s%> restitution <S%H7999><s%>; if he have nothing, then he shall be sold <S%H4376><s%> for his theft <S%H1591><s%>.

If the theft <S%H1591><s%> be certainly <S%H4672><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%> alive <S%H2416><s%>, whether it be ox <S%H7794><s%>, or ass <S%H2543><s%>, or sheep <S%H7716><s%>; he shall restore <S%H7999><s%> double <S%H8147><s%>.

¶ If a man <S%H376><s%> shall cause a field <S%H7704><s%> or vineyard <S%H3754><s%> to be eaten <S%H1197><s%>, and shall put <S%H7971><s%> in his beast <S%H1165><s%>, and shall feed <S%H1197><s%> in another man's <S%H312><s%> field <S%H7704><s%>; of the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own field <S%H7704><s%>, and of the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own vineyard <S%H3754><s%>, shall he make restitution <S%H7999><s%>.

¶ If fire <S%H784><s%> break out <S%H3318><s%>, and catch <S%H4672><s%> in thorns <S%H6975><s%>, so that the stacks of corn <S%H1430><s%>, or the standing corn <S%H7054><s%>, or the field <S%H7704><s%>, be consumed <S%H398><s%> therewith; he that kindled <S%H1197><s%> the fire <S%H1200><s%> shall surely <S%H7999><s%> make restitution <S%H7999><s%>.

¶ If a man <S%H376><s%> shall deliver <S%H5414><s%> unto his neighbour <S%H7453><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> or stuff <S%H3627><s%> to keep <S%H8104><s%>, and it be stolen <S%H1589><s%> out of the man's <S%H376><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>; if the thief <S%H1590><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%>, let him pay <S%H7999><s%> double <S%H8147><s%>.

If the thief <S%H1590><s%> be not <S%H3808><s%> found <S%H4672><s%>, then the master <S%H1167><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> shall be brought <S%H7126><s%> unto the judges <S%H430><s%>, to see whether he have put <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> unto his neighbour's <S%H7453><s%> goods <S%H4399><s%>.

For all manner <S%H1697><s%> of trespass <S%H6588><s%>, whether it be for ox <S%H7794><s%>, for ass <S%H2543><s%>, for sheep <S%H7716><s%>, for raiment <S%H8008><s%>, or for any manner of lost thing <S%H9><s%>, which another challengeth <S%H559><s%> to be his, the cause <S%H1697><s%> of both parties <S%H8147><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> before the judges <S%H430><s%>; and whom the judges <S%H430><s%> shall condemn <S%H7561><s%>, he shall pay <S%H7999><s%> double <S%H8147><s%> unto his neighbour <S%H7453><s%>.

If a man <S%H376><s%> deliver <S%H5414><s%> unto his neighbour <S%H7453><s%> an ass <S%H2543><s%>, or an ox <S%H7794><s%>, or a sheep <S%H7716><s%>, or any beast <S%H929><s%>, to keep <S%H8104><s%>; and it die <S%H4191><s%>, or be hurt <S%H7665><s%>, or driven away <S%H7617><s%>, no man seeing <S%H7200><s%> it:

Then shall an oath <S%H7621><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> be between them both <S%H8147><s%>, that he hath not put <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> unto his neighbour's <S%H7453><s%> goods <S%H4399><s%>; and the owner <S%H1167><s%> of it shall accept <S%H3947><s%> thereof, and he shall not make it good <S%H7999><s%>.
And if it be stolen <S%H1589><s%> <S%H1589><s%> from him, he shall make restitution <S%H7999><s%> unto the owner <S%H1167><s%> thereof.
If it be torn in pieces <S%H2963><s%> <S%H2963><s%>, then let him bring <S%H935><s%> it for witness <S%H5707><s%>, and he shall not make good <S%H7999><s%> that which was torn <S%H2966><s%>.

¶ And if a man <S%H376><s%> borrow <S%H7592><s%> ought of his neighbour <S%H7453><s%>, and it be hurt <S%H7665><s%>, or die <S%H4191><s%>, the owner <S%H1167><s%> thereof being not with it <S%H5973><s%>, he shall surely <S%H7999><s%> make it good <S%H7999><s%>.
But if the owner <S%H1167><s%> thereof be with it, he shall not make it good <S%H7999><s%>: if it be an hired <S%H7916><s%> thing, it came <S%H935><s%> for his hire <S%H7939><s%>.

¶ And if a man <S%H376><s%> entice <S%H6601><s%> a maid <S%H1330><s%> that is not betrothed <S%H781><s%>, and lie <S%H7901><s%> with her, he shall surely <S%H4117><s%> endow <S%H4117><s%> her to be his wife <S%H802><s%>.

If her father <S%H1><s%> utterly <S%H3985><s%> refuse <S%H3985><s%> to give <S%H5414><s%> her unto him, he shall pay <S%H8254><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> according to the dowry <S%H4119><s%> of virgins <S%H1330><s%>.
¶ Thou shalt not suffer a witch <S%H3784><s%> to live <S%H2421><s%>.
¶ Whosoever lieth <S%H7901><s%> with a beast <S%H929><s%> shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death <S%H4191><s%>.
¶ He that sacrificeth <S%H2076><s%> unto any god <S%H430><s%>, save <S%H1115><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> only, he shall be utterly destroyed <S%H2763><s%>.
¶ Thou shalt neither vex <S%H3238><s%> a stranger <S%H1616><s%>, nor oppress <S%H3905><s%> him: for ye were strangers <S%H1616><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.
¶ Ye shall not afflict <S%H6031><s%> any widow <S%H490><s%>, or fatherless child <S%H3490><s%>.

If <S%H518><s%> thou afflict <S%H6031><s%> them in any wise <S%H6031><s%>, and they cry <S%H6817><s%> at all <S%H6817><s%> unto me, I will surely <S%H8085><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> their cry <S%H6818><s%>;

And my wrath <S%H639><s%> shall wax hot <S%H2734><s%>, and I will kill <S%H2026><s%> you with the sword <S%H2719><s%>; and your wives <S%H802><s%> shall be widows <S%H490><s%>, and your children <S%H1121><s%> fatherless <S%H3490><s%>.

¶ If thou lend <S%H3867><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> to any of my people <S%H5971><s%> that is poor <S%H6041><s%> by thee, thou shalt not be to him as an usurer <S%H5383><s%>, neither shalt thou lay <S%H7760><s%> upon him usury <S%H5392><s%>.

If thou at all <S%H2254><s%> take <S%H2254><s%> thy neighbour's <S%H7453><s%> raiment <S%H8008><s%> to pledge <S%H2254><s%>, thou shalt deliver <S%H7725><s%> it unto him by <S%H5704><s%> that the sun <S%H8121><s%> goeth down <S%H935><s%>:

For that is his covering <S%H3682><s%> only, it is his raiment <S%H8071><s%> for his skin <S%H5785><s%>: wherein shall he sleep <S%H7901><s%>? and it shall come to pass, when he crieth <S%H6817><s%> unto me, that I will hear <S%H8085><s%>; for I am gracious <S%H2587><s%>.
¶ Thou shalt not revile <S%H7043><s%> the gods <S%H430><s%>, nor curse <S%H779><s%> the ruler <S%H5387><s%> of thy people <S%H5971><s%>.

¶ Thou shalt not delay <S%H309><s%> to offer the first of thy ripe fruits <S%H4395><s%>, and of thy liquors <S%H1831><s%>: the firstborn <S%H1060><s%> of thy sons <S%H1121><s%> shalt thou give <S%H5414><s%> unto me.

Likewise <S%H3651><s%> shalt thou do <S%H6213><s%> with thine oxen <S%H7794><s%>, and with thy sheep <S%H6629><s%>: seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> it shall be with his dam <S%H517><s%>; on the eighth <S%H8066><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> thou shalt give <S%H5414><s%> it me.

¶ And ye shall be holy <S%H6944><s%> men <S%H582><s%> unto me: neither shall ye eat <S%H398><s%> any flesh <S%H1320><s%> that is torn of beasts <S%H2966><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%>; ye shall cast <S%H7993><s%> it to the dogs <S%H3611><s%>.
